# startRecording(handler:)

**Instance Method**

Starts recording the app display.

## Declaration

```swift
func startRecording(handler: (((any Error)?) -> Void)? = nil)
```

## Parameters

- **handler**: A block that is called when the request completes.



## Discussion

Call [doc://com.apple.replaykit/documentation/ReplayKit/RPScreenRecorder/startRecording(handler:)] on an instance of the recorder to begin recording. When [doc://com.apple.replaykit/documentation/ReplayKit/RPScreenRecorder/startRecording(handler:)] is first called, an alert window appears asking the user to confirm recording. This alert window is also presented if it has been longer than 8 minutes since the last time [doc://com.apple.replaykit/documentation/ReplayKit/RPScreenRecorder/startRecording(handler:)] was called.

## Controlling App Recording

- **stopRecording(handler:)**: Stops the current recording.
- **stopRecording(withOutput:completionHandler:)**: Stops the current recording and writes the movie to the specified output URL.
- **startCapture(handler:completionHandler:)**: Starts screen and audio capture.
- **RPSampleBufferType**: The type of media clip sample being buffered.
- **stopCapture(handler:)**: Stops screen capture
- **discardRecording(handler:)**: Discards the current recording.
- **startRecording(withMicrophoneEnabled:handler:)**: Starts recording the app’s audio and video.
